input:
Sophia is a biologist with a passion for chronicling his vibrant life through weekly diary entries. Captures:
1) Family member birthday: husband (yourself) (birthday on May 13), my wife (birthday on September 19), my child_1 (birthday on September 06), my father (birthday on July 27), my mother (birthday on June 05), 
2) Attending a fashion week in Paris in week 24-25.

3) Attend a parenting workshop every 5 weeks on weekends, starting from week 13.
 4) Weekly updates on weather changes, work developments, family life, and other interesting topics.
5) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly entry (e.g. #*# Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
The New Year dawned frosty and bright, with temperatures stubbornly clinging to a cool 5°C. The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promise challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year)
Generate a complete weekly diary for Sophia for the entire year of 2018. Start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week. Each diary entry should be at least 200 words. When the design of all 52 weeks is complete, use '*** finished ***' to indicate the end of the document. Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the narrative throughout the year. *** started ***
#*# Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th):

checks_range.24: Attending a fashion week in Paris
checks_range.25: Attending a fashion week in Paris

Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th):
The New Year dawned frosty and bright, with temperatures stubbornly clinging to a cool 5°C. The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promise challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year.

At the lab, we were deep into the planning stages of our new projects, with brainstorming sessions and design meetings taking place daily. I was particularly excited about a new collaboration with a local architectural firm, which could lead to some groundbreaking advancements in sustainable urban design. Meanwhile, at home, my wife and I were busy organizing the kids' schedules for the upcoming school year. We signed them up for various extracurricular activities, including soccer, art classes, and music lessons. The evenings were spent helping them with their homework and preparing healthy meals. The week ended on a high note with a family dinner, where we shared stories of our week and looked forward to the adventures that the new year would bring.

Noah is a photographer with a passion for chronicling his vibrant life through weekly diary entries. Captures:
1) Family member birthday: husband (yourself) (birthday on March 08), my wife (birthday on July 09), my child_1 (birthday on November 06), my child_2 (birthday on August 31), my child_3 (birthday on November 17), 
2) Joining a fitness and wellness retreat in Bali in week 6-7.

3) Join a local running club for weekend marathons every 5 weeks on weekends, starting from week 10.
 4) Weekly updates on weather changes, work developments, family life, and other interesting topics.
5) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly entry (e.g. #*# Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
The New Year dawned frosty and bright, with temperatures stubbornly clinging to a cool 5°C. The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promise challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year)
Generate a complete weekly diary for Noah for the entire year of 2018. Start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week. Each diary entry should be at least 200 words. When the design of all 52 weeks is complete, use '*** finished ***' to indicate the end of the document. Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the narrative throughout the year. *** started ***
#*# Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th):

Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th):
The New Year dawned frosty and bright, with temperatures stubbornly clinging to a cool 5°C. The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promise challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year.

 Week 2 (January 8th - January 14th):
The second week of the year brought a welcome respite from the winter chill, with temperatures inching up to a balmy 8°C. The sun shone brightly, casting long shadows across the snow-covered ground. At work, the engineering team was in full swing, with everyone focused on their respective projects. I made significant progress on the energy efficiency design, refining the initial sketches and creating detailed 3D models. The team was excited about the potential impact of this project, and we spent hours discussing various design iterations and optimization techniques. At home, the kids were thrilled to be back in their routine, with school and extracurricular activities keeping them busy. My wife and I took advantage of the warmer weather to plan a weekend getaway to the nearby mountains. We packed our bags, eager to escape the city and breathe in some fresh mountain air.

 Week 3 (January 15th - January 21st):
The third week of the year was a productive one, both at work and at home. The engineering team was in the final stages of completing the design for the energy efficiency project, and we spent long hours in the lab perfecting the prototype. I was particularly focused on optimizing the design for maximum energy savings, working closely with our materials scientist to explore various insulation options. At home, the kids were in high spirits, with their weekend getaway still fresh in their minds. We spent the evenings playing board games and watching movies, enjoying the cozy warmth of our home. The weather took a turn for the worse, with heavy rain and strong winds making the streets slick and treacherous. We were grateful for the quiet indoor activities that kept us entertained during the storm.

 Week 4 (January 22nd - January 28th):
The fourth week of the year was marked by a flurry of activity, both at work and at home. At the engineering lab, the team was in the final stages of testing the energy efficiency prototype, and we were all eager to see the results. I spent the week fine-tuning the design, making adjustments based on the test data and collaborating with the team to address any issues. At home, the kids were busy with their school projects, and my wife and I were in the midst of planning a family vacation for the upcoming summer. We spent hours researching destinations and making travel arrangements, excited to explore new places and create new memories together.

 Week 5 (January 29th - February 4th):
The fifth week of the year brought a much-needed break from the hustle and bustle of work and family life. My wife and I decided to take a short vacation to the nearby coast, eager to escape the winter chill and recharge our batteries. We spent our days lounging on the beach, soaking up the sun and the sound of the waves. The kids were thrilled to be out of their routine, and we spent hours playing in the sand and swimming in the warm waters. The peaceful surroundings allowed us to reflect on our goals for the year and reconnect with each other.

 Week 6-7 (February 5th - February 18th):
The sixth and seventh weeks of the year were spent at a fitness and wellness retreat in Bali. I had been looking forward to this trip for months, eager to focus on my health and wellbeing. The retreat offered a range of activities, from yoga and meditation to hiking and massage therapy. I spent my days immersed in these practices, feeling my body and mind rejuvenate with each passing day. The retreat also offered opportunities to connect with like-minded individuals, and I made some new friends and learned valuable insights from their experiences.

At home, the kids were in the midst of their mid-year school reports, and my wife and I spent hours helping them study and prepare for their exams. We also took the opportunity to collaborate with other experts in the field, sharing ideas and insights and learning from each other's experiences. By the end of the week, we were feeling a sense of excitement and anticipation, with the promise of new and innovative solutions on the horizon.

 Week 50 (December 9th - December 15th):
The fiftieth week of the year was a time for growth and development, as we focused on expanding our knowledge and skills. At work, we spent the week attending seminars and workshops, learning about the latest trends and best practices in sustainable urban design. We also took the opportunity to mentor and coach our colleagues, sharing our expertise and experience and helping them grow in their careers. At home, we spent the evenings reading, writing, and practicing new hobbies, from painting to gardening to cooking. By the end of the week, we were feeling a sense of accomplishment and growth, with our knowledge and skills expanding in new and exciting ways.

 Week 51 (December 16th - December 22nd):
The fifty-first week of the year was a time for reflection and introspection, as we took a break from the hustle and bustle of daily life to recharge our batteries. We spent the week on a road trip through the countryside, taking in the beautiful scenery and enjoying the simple pleasures of the open road. We also took the opportunity to reflect on our goals and priorities for the year ahead, with the quiet and introspective atmosphere of the road providing the perfect backdrop for contemplation and reflection.

 Week 52 (December 23rd - December 31st):
The fifty-second week of the year was a time for creativity and self-expression, as we continued our road trip through the countryside. We spent the week exploring the natural beauty of the area, from the rolling hills to the crystal-clear lakes, and took the opportunity to capture our experiences through photography and writing. We also took the time to experiment with new recipes and cooking techniques, with the delicious aromas wafting through the car and adding to the sense of creativity and self-expression. As the year came to a close, we were feeling a sense of accomplishment and gratitude, with our experiences and memories providing a foundation for the year ahead.

Construct a skyscraper with 100 floors. Please follow the detailed floor assignments below:
1) Specific floors requirements:
  - Designate Floor 9 for tailor and custom dressmaking use.
  - Designate Floor 13 for martial arts dojo use.
  - Designate Floor 12 for boutique use.
  - Designate Floor 48 for baking and culinary school use.
  - Designate Floor 23 for art gallery use.
2) Range floors requirements: Allocate Floors 79 to 83 for a corporate headquarters for a major company.
3) Periodic floors requirements: Include a restaurant every 15 floors, starting from Floor 35
4) Document each floor independently with detailed descriptions of the intended facilities, architectural features, and unique design elements.
5) Use '#*#' to separate the documentation for each floor (e.g. #*# Floor 1: 
This entry-level floor serves as the primary lobby and reception area of the skyscraper, designed to provide a welcoming and sophisticated entrance. Here are the detailed features: 1) Atrium and Ceiling: The lobby boasts a grand atrium with a towering ceiling that enhances the sense of openness. An elegant, modern chandelier hangs centrally, casting a soft, ambient light that illuminates the space effectively. 2) Reception Area: At the heart of the lobby, the reception desk is crafted from polished marble, presenting a sleek and professional appearance. Construct a skyscraper with 100 floors. Please follow the detailed floor assignments below:
1) Specific floors requirements:
  - Designate Floor 32 for photography studio use.
  - Designate Floor 40 for legal services use.
  - Designate Floor 15 for retail store use.
  - Designate Floor 94 for retail store use.
  - Designate Floor 52 for office use.
2) Range floors requirements: Allocate Floors 72 to 77 for a extensive fitness and recreational gym.
3) Periodic floors requirements: Include a sky garden every 15 floors, starting from Floor 35
4) Document each floor independently with detailed descriptions of the intended facilities, architectural features, and unique design elements.
5) Use '#*#' to separate the documentation for each floor (e.g. #*# Floor 1: 
This entry-level floor serves as the primary lobby and reception area of the skyscraper, designed to provide a welcoming and sophisticated entrance. Here are the detailed features: 1) Atrium and Ceiling: The lobby boasts a grand atrium with a towering ceiling that enhances the sense of openness. An elegant, modern chandelier hangs centrally, casting a soft, ambient light that illuminates the space effectively. 2) Reception Area: At the heart of the lobby, the reception desk is crafted from polished marble, presenting a sleek and professional appearance. Staff at the reception are well-equipped to assist visitors and employees. 3) Seating Arrangements: Surrounding the reception are multiple seating areas, featuring contemporary sofas and armchairs that offer comfort and style. These areas are ideal for informal meetings or waiting guests. These elements come together to create an impressive first impression for anyone entering the skyscraper, ensuring functionality meets style right from the entrance.).
 Ensure that the document consists of 100 entries, each containing at least 150 words. Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the narrative throughout the document. When the design of all 100 floors is complete, use '*** finished' to indicate the end of the document. *** started ***

input:
As Chef Roy Hee, a world-renowned chef at a globally renowned restaurant, you are tasked with designing an entire year's menu for 2018. Your menu should be varied and innovative, adhering to the following guidelines:
1): 1.1 Celebrate 'Midsummer Night's Feast' on 01-21 with a special dish: Grilled Salmon.
1.2 Celebrate 'Winter Solstice Feast' on 05-13 with a special dish: Venison Stew.
1.3 Celebrate 'Australia Day BBQ' on 01-26 with a special dish: Lamb Chops.
1.4 Celebrate 'April Fool's Surprise Menu' on 04-01 with a special dish: Mystery Dish.
1.5 Celebrate 'Restaurant's 10th Anniversary' on 09-19 with a special dish: Champagne and Caviar.
2) Feature 'Game Meat Fortnight' from Week 26 to Week 28 with dishes like: Venison Steaks.

Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th):
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. The shrimp are succulent and sweet, while the cocktail sauce adds a tangy, spicy kick.
1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. The earthy flavor of the mushrooms is beautifully complemented by the savory, aromatic cheese filling.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. The rich, velvety sauce clings to the tender lobster meat, creating a luxurious and indulgent dish.
2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. The crispy skin gives way to juicy, flavorful meat, while the sweet orange glaze adds a delightful contrast.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. The subtle garlic flavor adds depth and complexity to the classic dish, making it a perfect accompaniment to the rich main courses.
3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. The glaze adds a touch of sweetness and a beautiful sheen to the carrots, making them a delightful and colorful addition to the meal.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. The velvety texture and intense chocolate flavor make this a decadent and indulgent dessert that is sure to satisfy any sweet tooth.
4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. The coffee-infused ladyfingers are soft and spongey, while the creamy mascarpone cheese adds a rich, velvety texture.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. The sommelier will be happy to help you choose the perfect pairing for your dish.
5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings.
 Menu Week 2 (January 8th - January 14th):
This week's menu features a selection of dishes that are both hearty and comforting, perfect for the chilly winter weather.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) French Onion Soup: A classic soup made with caramelized onions, beef broth, and crusty bread. The rich, savory flavors are balanced by the sweetness of the onions, making for a comforting and satisfying start to the meal.
1.2) Bruschetta: Grilled bread topped with ripe tomatoes, fresh basil, and a drizzle of olive oil. The combination of the crispy bread, juicy tomatoes, and fragrant basil creates a delicious and refreshing appetizer.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Beef Bourguignon: A classic French stew made with tender beef, red wine, and a variety of vegetables. The slow-cooked flavors meld together to create a rich, hearty dish that is sure to warm you up on a cold winter night.
2.2) Chicken Pot Pie: A comforting dish made with tender chicken, vegetables, and a flaky, buttery crust. The savory filling is topped with a golden, crispy crust that adds a delightful texture to the dish.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Mashed Sweet Potatoes: Creamy mashed sweet potatoes seasoned with a hint of cinnamon and nutmeg. The subtle sweetness of the potatoes is a perfect complement to the savory main courses.
3.2) Green Beans Almondine: Crispy green beans tossed with almonds and a buttery, garlic sauce. The crunchy almonds add a delightful texture and a nutty, savory flavor to the dish.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Apple Crisp: A classic dessert made with tart apples, a crispy oat topping, and a scoop of vanilla ice cream. The sweet, caramelized apples are topped with a crispy, crunchy oat topping, making for a delicious and comforting dessert.
4.2) Chocolate Cake: A rich, decadent chocolate cake topped with a velvety chocolate ganache. The moist, chocolatey cake is a perfect indulgence for those with a sweet tooth.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Red Wine: A bold, full-bodied red wine to complement the rich flavors of the main courses.
5.2) Hot Chocolate: A warm, comforting cup of hot chocolate topped with whipped cream and a sprinkle of cocoa powder.
 Menu Week 3 (January 15th - January 21st):
This week, we celebrate 'Midsummer Night's Feast' with a special menu that features grilled salmon as the centerpiece.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Grilled Peaches: Juicy peaches grilled to perfection and served with a dollop of mascarpone cheese and a drizzle of honey. The sweet, caramelized flavors of the peaches are beautifully complemented by the tangy, creamy mascarpone cheese.
1.2) Grilled Asparagus: Tender asparagus grilled until charred and served with a lemon-garlic aioli. The smoky, charred flavors of the asparagus are balanced by the tangy, garlicky aioli, making for a delicious and refreshing appetizer.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Grilled Salmon: Fresh salmon fillets grilled to perfection and served with a citrusy glaze. The tender, juicy salmon is infused with the smoky flavors of the grill, while the citrusy glaze adds a delightful sweetness and a beautiful sheen.
2.2) Grilled Vegetable Skewers: A colorful array of vegetables grilled to perfection and served on skewers. The smoky, charred flavors of the vegetables are a perfect complement to the tender, juicy salmon.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Grilled Corn on the Cob: Sweet corn grilled until tender and served with a smoky, chili-lime butter. The smoky, spicy butter adds a delightful kick to the sweet, juicy corn.
3.2) Grilled Zucchini: Tender zucchini grilled until charred and served with a tangy, balsamic glaze. The smoky, charred flavors of the zucchini are beautifully complemented by the tangy, sweet balsamic glaze.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Grilled Pineapple: Juicy pineapple grilled until caramelized and served with a scoop of vanilla ice cream. The sweet, caramelized flavors of the pineapple are a perfect complement to the cool, creamy ice cream.
4.2) Grilled Peaches and Cream: Grilled peaches served with a scoop of vanilla ice cream and a drizzle of honey. The sweet, caramelized flavors of the peaches are beautifully complemented by the cool, creamy ice cream.
5. Drinks:
5.1) White Wine: A crisp, refreshing white wine to complement the light, grilled flavors of the menu.
5.2) Iced Tea: A cool, refreshing glass of iced tea to quench your thirst and cleanse your palate between courses.

input:
As Chef Roy Hee, a world-renowned chef at a globally renowned restaurant, you are tasked with designing an entire year's menu for 2018. Your menu should be varied and innovative, adhering to the following guidelines:
1): 1.1 Celebrate 'Father's Day Feast' on 06-17 with a special dish: Barbecued Ribs.
1.2 Celebrate 'Saint Patrick's Day' on 03-17 with a special dish: Irish Stew.
1.3 Celebrate 'Midsummer Night's Feast' on 02-02 with a special dish: Grilled Salmon.

Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th):
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream.
1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell.
2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic.
3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream.
4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals.
5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings.
 Menu Week 2 (January 8th - January 14th):
This week's menu features dishes that are hearty and warming, perfect for the chilly winter weather.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) French Onion Soup: A classic soup made with caramelized onions, beef broth, and crusty bread.
1.2) Spinach and Artichoke Dip: A creamy dip made with spinach, artichokes, and melted cheese, served with pita chips.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Beef Bourguignon: A rich, slow-cooked stew made with beef, red wine, onions, and mushrooms.
2.2) Chicken Pot Pie: A comforting dish made with chicken, vegetables, and a flaky pie crust.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Roasted Root Vegetables: A medley of root vegetables roasted until tender and caramelized.
3.2) Mashed Sweet Potatoes: Sweet potatoes mashed with butter, brown sugar, and a hint of cinnamon.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Apple Crisp: A classic dessert made with apples, oats, and brown sugar, topped with a crispy crumb topping.
4.2) Pecan Pie: A decadent pie made with pecans, corn syrup, and a buttery pie crust.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Red Wine: A full-bodied red wine to pair with the rich flavors of the main courses.
5.2) Hot Chocolate: A warm, comforting beverage made with real chocolate and milk.
 Menu Week 3 (January 15th - January 21st):

As Chef Roy Hee, a world-renowned chef at a globally renowned restaurant, you are tasked with designing an entire year's menu for 2018. Your menu should be varied and innovative, adhering to the following guidelines:
1): 1.1 Celebrate 'Midsummer Night's Feast' on 03-28 with a special dish: Grilled Salmon.
1.2 Celebrate 'Valentine's Day Special' on 02-14 with a special dish: Heart-Shaped Red Velvet Cake.
1.3 Celebrate 'Easter Brunch' on 04-01 with a special dish: Spring Lamb Roast.
1.4 Celebrate 'Summer Solstice Celebration' on 12-09 with a special dish: Midsummer Night's Fish Fry.
1.5 Celebrate 'Pancake Day Treat' on 02-13 with a special dish: Blueberry Pancakes.
2) Feature 'Winter Delicacies' from Week 17 to Week 18 with dishes like: Braised Game Meats.
3) Include 'Soup and Salad Midweek' every 2 weeks starting from Week 2, serving: Seasonal Soup and Salad.
4) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly menu (e.g. #*# Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort. 1. Appetizers: 1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. 1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. 2. Desserts: 4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. 4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. 5. Drinks: 5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. 5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings. This week's menu sets the tone for a year of gourmet experiences, starting with dishes that combine classic techniques with festive flavors.)
Generate a comprehensive weekly menu diary for the entire year of 2018, start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week.
- Each weekly menu must include a detailed description of the offerings, featuring at least two options for appetizers, main courses, side dishes, desserts, and drinks. Aim for between 200 and 220 words per menu description to ensure thoroughness and richness of detail.
- Conclude the diary with '*** finished' to signify the completion of the year's menu planning.
- Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the menu throughout the year. *** started ***

Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th):
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream.
1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell.
2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic.
3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream.
4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals.
5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings.
 Menu Week 2 (January 8th - January 14th):
Soup and Salad Midweek.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Caprese Skewers: Cherry tomatoes, fresh mozzarella, and basil leaves drizzled with balsamic glaze.
1.2) Spinach and Artichoke Dip: A creamy, warm dip made with spinach, artichoke hearts, and garlic, served with pita chips.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Grilled Chicken Alfredo: Tender chicken breast smothered in a creamy Alfredo sauce, served over pasta.
2.2) Vegetarian Lasagna: Layers of pasta, vegetables, and cheese baked to perfection.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Caesar Salad: Romaine lettuce topped with croutons, parmesan cheese, and Caesar dressing.
3.2) Minestrone Soup: A hearty vegetable soup filled with beans, pasta, and vegetables.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Apple Crisp: A warm, sweet dessert made with apples, oats, and brown sugar, topped with vanilla ice cream.
4.2) Cheesecake: A rich, velvety cheesecake with a graham cracker crust and a tangy lemon zest topping.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Assorted Beers: A selection of craft beers to pair with the hearty main courses.
5.2) Lemonade: A refreshing, tangy beverage to complement the lighter dishes.
 Menu Week 3 (January 15th - January 21st):
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Bruschetta: Toasted bread topped with tomatoes, garlic, basil, and mozzarella.
1.2) Crab Cakes: Delicate crab cakes made with jumbo lump crab meat, served with a tangy remoulade sauce.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Beef Bourguignon: A rich, hearty stew made with beef, red wine, onions, and mushrooms.
2.2) Vegetarian Paella: A colorful, flavorful rice dish made with saffron, vegetables, and beans.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Green Beans Almondine: Tender green beans sautéed with almonds and browned butter.
3.2) Mashed Sweet Potatoes: Sweet potatoes mashed with butter, brown sugar, and a hint of cinnamon.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Chocolate Brownies: Fudgy, decadent chocolate brownies topped with a scoop of vanilla ice cream.
4.2) Crème Brûlée: A classic French dessert with a rich, creamy custard topped with a caramelized sugar crust.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Red Wine: A full-bodied red wine to complement the rich flavors of the main courses.
5.2) Sparkling Water: A refreshing, non-alcoholic beverage to cleanse the palate between courses.
 Menu Week 4 (January 22nd - January 28th):
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Shrimp Ceviche: Fresh shrimp marinated in lime juice, mixed with tomatoes, onions, and cilantro.
1.2) Spinach and Feta Phyllo Triangles: Triangles of phyllo dough filled with spinach, feta cheese, and garlic, baked until crispy.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Veal Parmesan: Tender veal cutlets breaded and fried, topped with marinara sauce and melted mozzarella cheese.
2.2) Vegetarian Stuffed Bell Peppers: Bell peppers stuffed with rice, beans, corn, and cheese, baked until tender.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Quinoa Salad: A light, refreshing salad made with quinoa, cucumber, tomatoes, and avocado, dressed with a citrus vinaigrette.
3.2) Roasted Brussels Sprouts: Brussels sprouts roasted until tender and caramelized, finished with a drizzle of balsamic glaze.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Lemon Tart: A tangy, sweet dessert made with a lemon curd filling and a buttery, flaky crust.
4.2) Chocolate Chip Cookies: Warm, gooey chocolate chip cookies served with a scoop of vanilla ice cream.
5. Drinks:
5.1) White Wine: A crisp, refreshing white wine to complement the lighter dishes.
5.2) Hot Chocolate: A rich, decadent hot chocolate topped with whipped cream and marshmallows.

1): 1.1 Celebrate 'Christmas Gala Dinner' on 12-25 with a special dish: Roasted Goose.

Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th):
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream.
1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell.
2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic.
3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream.
4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals.
5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings.

1): 1.1 Celebrate 'Christmas Gala Dinner' on 12-25 with a special dish: Roasted Goose.

- Each weekly menu must include a detailed description of the offerings, featuring at least two options for appetizers, main courses, side dishes, desserts, and drinks. Aim for between 200 and 220 words per menu description to ensure thoroughness and richness of detail.

Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th):
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream.
1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell.
2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic.
3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream.
4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals.
5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings.

5.2) Sangria: A refreshing and fruity drink made with red wine, fruit, and brandy.
 Menu Week 19 (May 7th - May 13th):
This week's menu features dishes that are comforting and cozy, perfect for those cold winter nights.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Tomato Soup: A classic and comforting soup made with fresh tomatoes, onions, and garlic.
1.2) Grilled Cheese Sandwich: A classic sandwich made with bread, cheese, and butter, served with a cup of tomato soup.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Beef Stroganoff: A hearty and comforting dish made with beef, mushrooms, and sour cream.
2.2) Chicken Pot Pie: A comforting and homely dish made with chicken, vegetables, and a flaky pie crust.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes seasoned with milk, butter, and salt.
3.2) Green Beans: Steamed green beans seasoned with garlic and olive oil, a healthy and delicious side dish.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Apple Crisp: A classic dessert made with apples, oats, and brown sugar, baked until golden and crispy.
4.2) Chocolate Chip Cookies: A classic and comforting dessert made with chocolate chips and a scoop of vanilla ice cream.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Hot Chocolate: A warm and comforting beverage made with rich cocoa powder and milk.
5.2) Apple Cider: A classic and comforting beverage made with apple juice, cinnamon, and sugar.
 Menu Week 20 (May 14th - May 20th):
This week's menu features dishes that are light and refreshing, perfect for those looking to start the week off on a healthy note.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Caprese Salad: A classic Italian salad made with fresh tomatoes, mozzarella, and basil, drizzled with balsamic glaze.
1.2) Edamame: Steamed soybeans seasoned with sea salt, a popular Japanese appetizer.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Grilled Chicken Salad: A healthy and delicious salad made with grilled chicken, mixed greens, and a tangy vinaigrette.
2.2) Quinoa Bowl: A hearty and nutritious bowl made with quinoa, vegetables, and a tangy dressing.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Grilled Asparagus: Tender asparagus spears grilled until slightly charred and seasoned with olive oil and salt.
3.2) Roasted Beets: Roasted beets served with a tangy vinaigrette, a colorful and delicious side dish.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Fruit Tart: A classic French dessert made with a tart shell and fresh fruit.
4.2) Sorbet: A refreshing and light dessert made with fruit and sugar, served frozen.
5. Drinks:
5.1) White Wine: A crisp and refreshing white wine to pair with the light main courses.
5.2) Iced Tea: A refreshing and caffeine-free beverage made with black tea and served over ice.
 Menu Week 21 (May 21st - May 27th):
This week's menu features dishes that are spicy and bold, perfect for those looking to add some excitement to their meals.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Spicy Tuna Roll: A classic sushi roll made with spicy tuna, avocado, and cucumber.
1.2) Jalapeno Poppers: Jalapeno peppers stuffed with cream cheese and breadcrumbs, baked until golden and crispy.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Chili Con Carne: A hearty and spicy stew made with beef, beans, and chili peppers.
2.2) Pad Thai: A popular Thai dish made with rice noodles, vegetables, and a spicy peanut sauce.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Fried Rice: A flavorful side dish made with rice, vegetables, and scrambled eggs.
3.2) Sautéed Spinach: Sautéed spinach seasoned with garlic and chili flakes, a healthy and delicious side

Ensure that each block is uniquely planned to reflect a wide array of city facilities, highlighting the rich urban environment and cultural diversity.1) Specific block requirements:
  - Designate Block at (3, 0) for botanical garden use.
  - Designate Block at (7, 5) for library use.
  - Designate Block at (6, 9) for farm use.
  - Designate Block at (1, 6) for industrial sector use.
  - Designate Block at (4, 7) for botanical garden use.
2) Range block requirements: Allocate a shopping district along the row from (7, 2) to (7, 5).
3) Periodic block requirements: Include a coffee shop starting from Block at (0, 5) with an interval of every 4 blocks along the column.
4) Document each block independently with detailed descriptions of the intended facilities, architectural features, and unique design elements.
5) Use '#*#' to separate the documentation for each block like (e.g. #*# Block 1 (0, 0):

Design a vibrant and diverse city using a 10x10 block grid, numbered from 1 to 100. Arrange the blocks sequentially from left to right and top to bottom. Ensure that each block is uniquely planned to reflect a wide array of city facilities, highlighting the rich urban environment and cultural diversity.1) Specific block requirements:
  - Designate Block at (3, 0) for library use.
  - Designate Block at (3, 8) for school use.
  - Designate Block at (1, 3) for industrial sector use.
  - Designate Block at (9, 2) for industrial sector use.
  - Designate Block at (5, 0) for residential area use.
2) Range block requirements: Allocate a shopping district along the column from (2, 8) to (3, 8).
3) Periodic block requirements: Include a small park starting from Block at (0, 5) with an interval of every 4 blocks along the column.
4) Document each block independently with detailed descriptions of the intended facilities, architectural features, and unique design elements.
5) Use '#*#' to separate the documentation for each block like (e.g. #*# Block 1 (0, 0): 
This block is the entry point to the cultural quarter and is dedicated to a contemporary art gallery. The details are as follows: Architecture: The building is designed with expansive glass facades and a minimalist aesthetic, making it a landmark in the cityscape. Its structure allows for maximum natural light, which highlights the artworks inside and creates an inviting atmosphere for visitors. Purpose: The gallery showcases a wide range of artworks from both local and international artists. It serves as a platform for cultural exchange and artistic expression, featuring everything from traditional paintings to modern digital installations. City Value: As a pivotal part of the cultural quarter, this gallery enhances the city's reputation as a center for arts and culture. It attracts tourists and art lovers, providing a significant boost to the local economy. The gallery also offers educational programs and workshops, fostering community engagement and supporting local artists.)
Ensure that the document consists of 100 entries, each containing at least 150 words. Ensure that the document contains detailed descriptions for each block, with a minimum of 150 words per description. Ensure clarity and continuity in the narrative throughout the document without any interruptions or omissions. When all block assignments are complete, use '*** finished' to indicate the end of the document. *** started ***
#*# Block 1 (0, 0):
